name: retexture
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to give something a new or different texture (= the way something feels when you touch it): She had a chemical peel to retexture her skin. Someone had taken the wallpaper off and tried to retexture the walls.
More examplesFewer examplesAll the elements of the painting can be recoloured, retextured, and reshaped.She not only repainted the walls of their house, she also re-textured the ceiling and re-tiled the floors.The dark blue carpets had been retextured over the years by multiple cigarette burns and spilled drinks.
